intro: Lappula transalaica, commonly known as the Transalpine lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open areas where it can receive ample sunlight. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late summer. Lappula transalaica is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
